awd_titl_txt: Quantification of Biodegradation of Wood at Inaccessible    Locations
awd_abstract_narration: This Phase II research will focus on the investigation of the                   refinement of the geometric and mathematical models used in                     conjunction with nondestructive evaluation (NDE) methods to                     quantify the biodegradation of wood at inaccessible locations.                  The emphasis will be on the prediction methodology for planes                   located at distances from the NDE excitation and output sensing                 planes.  Additional research will include the quantification of                 the effects of geometric (shape, size, check, boundary                          conditions) and environmental (moisture content, temperature)                   factors on the NDE methodology.  The data base used for model                   building and model verification will be greatly expanded to                     incorporate several species and product types.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
